file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 32-41-01-04 - BRAKE PEDAL TRANSDUCER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL BRAKE PEDAL TRANSDUCER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the brake-pedal position-transducers (BRAKE PPTRAN). B. Access to the brake-pedal position-transducers is got through the hatch. C. These procedures are applicable to the four brake-pedal position-transducers. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY BRAKE-PEDAL POSITION-TRANSDUCER ALL 32-41-01-000-801-A - REMOVAL BRAKE-PEDAL POSITION-TRANSDUCER ALL 32-41-01-400-801-A - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 32-41-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-41-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. BRAKE-PEDAL POSITION-TRANSDUCER - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the brake-pedal position-transducers (BRAKE PPTRAN). B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 123 123BL Area below the cockpit floor - LH D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Area below the cockpit floor - LH I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Open access hatch 123BL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Disconnect the springs (6) and (7). (2) Disconnect the electrical connectors (1) and (2). (3) Remove the nut (3), washer (4), and bolt (5). (4) Remove the nut (13), washers (12) and (9), and bolt (8). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-41-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NOTE: When you remove the bolt (8), the two brake-pedal position-transducers are disconnected from their supports. (5) Remove the transducers (10) and (11). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-41-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY:: ALL Brake-Pedal Position-Transducer (BRAKE PPTRAN) - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 123 124 B COPILOT D PPTRAN 1 PPTRAN 4 C PILOT PPTRAN 2 PPTRAN 3 DET. A DET. B DET. C 1. ELECTRICAL 8. BOLT CONNECTOR 9. WASHER 12. WASHER 13. NUT 2. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 4. WASHER (2) 3. NUT (2) 11. TRANDUCER (PPTRAN) 5. BOLT (2) 4. WASHER (2) 10. TRANDUCER 5. BOLT (2) (PPTRAN) 4. WASHER (2) 7. SPRING 6. SPRING 4. WASHER (2) 3. NUT (2) DET. D 145AMM320096.MCE B EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-41-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-41-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. BRAKE-PEDAL POSITION-TRANSDUCER - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the brake-pedal position-transducers (BRAKE PPTRAN). B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM TASK 32-41-00-700-801-A/500 MAIN BRAKE SYSTEM - FUNCTIONAL CHECK AMM TASK 32-41-01-700-802-A/500 BRAKE PEDAL TRANSDUCER - FUNCTIONAL TEST C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 123 123BL Area below the cockpit floor - LH D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Area below the cockpit floor - LH I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Turn the transducers (10) and (11) clockwise until they are free. (2) Install the transducers (10) and (11). (3) Install the washer (9), bolt (8), washer (12), and nut (13). NOTE: When you install the bolt (8), the two brake-pedal position-transducers are connected to on their supports. (4) Install the bolt (5), washer (4), and nut (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-41-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 50 - Apr 29/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (5) Connect the electrical connectors (1) and (2). (6) Connect the springs (6) and (7). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close access hatch 123BL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (2) Do the functional check of the Brake Pedal Transducer (AMM TASK 32-41-01-700-802-A/500) and the functional check of the Main Brake System ( AMM TASK 32-41-00-700-801-A/500).
